text: The PR3 mixed double sculls competition at the 2019 World Rowing Championships took place at the Linz-Ottensheim regatta venue. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Wednesday 28 August 2019 || 10:08 || Test race |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| Friday 30 August 2019 || style=background:lemonchiffon| 15:19 || style=background:lemonchiffon| Final |} All times are Central European Summer Time (UTC+2) ==Results== ===Test race=== With fewer than seven entries in this event, boats contested a race for lanes before the final. {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Valentina Zhagot Evgenii Borisov | align="left"| | 7:50.54 |- | 2 | align="left"|Johanna Beyer David Erkinger | align="left"| | 8:00.46 |- | 3 | align="left"|Joshua Boissoneau Pearl Outlaw | align="left"| | 8:15.77 |- | 4 | align="left"|Wang Xixi Chen Xinxin | align="left"| | 8:19.70 |- | 5 | align="left"|Saleh Shahin Shay-Lee Mizrachi | align="left"| | 8:26.09 |- | 6 | align="left"|Maryam Afgei Gianfilippo Mirabile | align="left"| | 8:36.35 |} ===Final=== The final determined the rankings. {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | | align="left"|Valentina Zhagot Evgenii Borisov | align="left"| | 7:48.32 |- | | align="left"|Johanna Beyer David Erkinger | align="left"| | 8:01.12 |- | | align="left"|Joshua Boissoneau Pearl Outlaw | align="left"| | 8:17.51 |- | 4 | align="left"|Wang Xixi Chen Xinxin | align="left"| | 8:22.95 |- | 5 | align="left"|Saleh Shahin Shay-Lee Mizrachi | align="left"| | 8:30.70 |- | 6 | align="left"|Maryam Afgei Gianfilippo Mirabile | align="left"| | 8:49.62 |} ==References== Category:2019 World Rowing Championships
title: 2019 World Rowing Championships – PR3 Mixed double sculls
